results.title: Baxter earns his wings
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig, Rosemarie Shapley, Roman Kroitor and Don Arioli
results.brief_description: Taking the roles of different characters, two actors perform the life story of a person called Baxter. The various significant stages of Baxter’s life, his death and his acceptance into heaven are performed. This delightful production has no dialogue but is accompanied by the actors’ own sound effects. Patrice Arbour stars as Baxter and Bernard Carez as all other characters.

results.title: Bauhaus: face of the twentieth century
results.creator_credit: BBC, RM Arts and Julia Cave
results.brief_description: The development, key figures involved and the historical, political and economic context of the Bauhaus school of architecture, design, and craftsmanship is detailed in this program with narration by Frank Whitford. It is a comprehensive historical and analytical study of the movement which was a turning point in European and then world-wide thought on varied facets of design through its integration of notions of design, industry and functionality. This relationship created designs, buildings, art works and performance art synonymous with rationalised, sharp-edged and industry machine based ideals, which are closely analysed in this program from its development in the early 1900s to the struggles of the revolutionary aims of those involved during the Nazi regime and its contemporary influence. It presents a collection of archival footage, interviews with relevant experts as well as its students and teachers and the representation and discussion of an array of exemplary works and achieves a thorough outline of the Bauhaus school and its impact on modern design and architecture.

results.title: Batu caves
results.brief_description: A group of school children explores Batu Caves in Kuala Lumpur and discover interesting examples of Malayan wild life. Many varieties of bats are the chief inhabitants, while various insects, snails, crickets, centipedes, scorpions, white snakes and small crustaceans are also to be found. No other credits available.

results.title: Battlestar Galactica. Vol. 03
results.brief_description: In Part One of ‘The gun on ice planet zero’, Starbuck and Boomer discover a small, icy planet known to the Cylons as Arcta while on a deep space mission with three cadets. A sudden beam from a laser built into a mountain on Arcta obliterates one of the cadets, and Cylon interceptors appear, forcing one of the other cadets to land on the surface. Adama becomes convinced that the Galactica is being herded toward the planet as part of a Cylon plot, and orders a team of prisoners specially recruited for the job to accompany Apollo on a mission to attack the Cylon garrison and destroy the laser cannon. On Arcta, Apollo is assisted by a group of Theta-class clones, who reveal that their “father-creator” Dr. Ravashol was responsible for designing the weapon. Baltar, back in charge, orders more basestars to attack the Galactica. In Part Two, Apollo must help evacuate the clones from their underground city before the weapon can be destroyed. As Cylons pour into the villages, searching for the missing landing party, it becomes a race against time to disable the Cylon command centre and demolish the weapon before it can be used against the Galactica. Stars Lorne Green as Adama, Richard Hatch as Apollo, Dirk Benedict as Starbuck, Noah Hathaway as Boxey, and John Colicos as Baltar.

results.title: Battlestar Galactica. Vol. 02
results.brief_description: In ‘Lost planet of the Gods’, Apollo and Serina are finalising details of their impending marriage, and Apollo is starting to feel pressured to follow suit. Both go on what Starbuck believes may be their last Viper scouting mission together, only to fly into a vast black void that scrambles their navigation and communication equipment. They manage to find their way out, not realising that Baltar - hiding on his base-star in the magnetic void - has allowed them to escape so he can track them back to the battlestar Galactica. Meanwhile, Boomer and Jolly discover a Cylon outpost stationed on the surface of an asteroid, and rush back to warn the Galactica, unaware that the Cylons had seen them. Bypassing the decontamination process in order to get to Apollo’s bachelor party, both men suddenly succumb to an unknown virus, and Dr. Salik orders the quarantine of all of the Galactica’s Viper Corps except Starbuck and Apollo, rendering the ship defenseless. In order to synthesise a cure, Dr. Salik must return to the asteroid to find the cause, so Adama orders the recruitment of female shuttle pilots for Viper training so they can protect him from attack. Catching the outpost by surprise, the newly recruited Viper pilots defeat the Cylon fleet. In Part Two of ‘Lost planet of the Gods’, Adama directs the Galactica to fly into the void earlier discovered by Apollo and Starbuck in search of the mythical planet Kobol. While out intercepting another Cylon strike force, Starbuck is captured, and taken to Baltar, who claims the Cylons want peace. Meanwhile, back on the Galactica, with the threat of attack hanging over the ship, Apollo and Serina marry. The Galactica is guided to a remote planet by a star as foretold in the Book of the Word, and upon landing, Adama, Apollo and Serina realise that they have found Kobol. However, Baltar is waiting for them, anxious to make amends and negotiate peace. As the Cylons attack the planet, Adama discovers clues as to the path of the “thirteenth tribe”, and Baltar is punished for his treachery. However, the discoveries made are soon overshadowed by the tragic death of one of the Galactica’s inhabitants. Stars Lorne Green as Adama, Richard Hatch as Apollo, Dirk Benedict as Starbuck, Jane Seymour as Serina, Noah Hathaway as Boxey, and John Colicos as Baltar.

results.title: Battleship Potemkin (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This renowned Soviet feature portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. An epic dramatisation, it brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage, stress on intellectual content and his treatment of the mass instead of the individual as protagonist.

results.title: Battlefield pilot
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Defence and Vincent Donovan
results.brief_description: Australian Army pilots are among the best low level fliers in the world. The film demonstrates their skill by observing in depth a low level training flight by an Army pilot in a Pilatus Porter aircraft.

results.title: Battle scars: an overview of our defence against disease
results.creator_credit: East Australian Film Corporation, VEA and Bob Hardie
results.brief_description: This program investigates the Human immune system and what defences the human body has against disease. Topics covered in this area include: physical barriers against disease, means of pathogenic entry into the body, defences of the body against entry of pathogens, antigens and antibodies, role of phagocytes, the immune system and its function, the nature of immunity, vaccines and their development and the function of antibiotics.

results.title: Battle royale (Collector's edition) [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Battle Royale Production Committee, Sato Masao, Okada Masumi and Kinji Fukasaku
results.brief_description: Based on Koshun Takami’s novel “Shockwave”, Kinji Fukasaku’s controversial “Battle Royale” is a heady mix of violence and satire, which has drawn many comparisons to Kubrick’s “A Clockwork orange”. Not surprising, given that both films have sparked debates regarding the nature of cinema violence and its affects, while offering up an apocalyptic vision of the not too distant future. At the dawn of the new millennium Japan is teetering on the brink of chaos. Unemployment is at an all-time high and youth violence is spiralling out of control. The solution? The Battle Royale Act, a brutal government initiative which requires a randomly chosen group of teenage students to be taken to a deserted island where they must fight each other to the death. The sole survivor of the contest will become an example to Japanese youth of the extremes the government is prepared to go to in order to restore order. With its tongue firmly planted in its cheek, “Battle Royale” taps into the zeitgeist of Japanese society’s biggest fears and secret desires, as we watch in unflinching detail Japanese teenagers hack, shoot, poison and bludgeon each other to death. Warning: Some scenes may disturb. Cast includes: Takeshi Kitano, Aki Maeda, Tatsuya Fujiwara and Taro Yamamoto.

results.title: Battle prelude
results.brief_description: With commentary by Wilfred Thomas, this is a record of the Australian Army Jungle-Training School at Canungra in Queensland during World War II. No other credits available.
